paper: Learning to Reject Low-Quality Explanations via User Feedback

differences.why_impacts_score: Raises technical soundness and reproducibility concerns

evidence.baseline_quote: The augmentation assumes label preservation under selective Gaussian perturbations (Equation 2; Section 3.1: “we stipulate…”).
evidence.final_quote: Equation 2’s covariance specification “ε0 s × Σ” ... raising concerns about positive semi-definiteness and unambiguous implementation.

differences.summary: Undefined Cz in human study augmentation pipeline
differences.why_impacts_score: Undermines implementability and fidelity of the human-annotated evaluation

evidence.baseline_quote: The paper details recruitment, vetting, and interface design for human ratings and per-feature feedback (Section 4.2; Appendix D.3).
evidence.final_quote: Only incorrect features are annotated; the derivation of Cz is not specified.

differences.summary: Unclear probability/variance computations for baselines and metrics
differences.why_impacts_score: Threatens fairness/comparability of baselines and metric validity

evidence.baseline_quote: Eight baselines span standard LtR and explanation-aware strategies ... ensuring broad coverage and experimental rigor.
evidence.final_quote: SVC does not provide calibrated probabilities; manuscript does not state how probabilities were obtained.

differences.summary: Clarity score reduced due to reporting omissions
differences.why_impacts_score: Missing main-text sample size and implementation details reduce clarity

evidence.baseline_quote: Clarity (10): 8 — Well-structured with precise definitions ... comprehensive experimental details.
evidence.final_quote: Clarity (10): 7 — improve reporting on human-study sample size ... and implementation details.

differences.summary: Technical Quality score reduced with added methodological concerns
differences.why_impacts_score: New ambiguities and baseline metric issues justify lower technical quality

evidence.baseline_quote: Technical Quality (10): 6 — Method is sound and robustly evaluated ... lacks theoretical guarantees.
evidence.final_quote: Technical Quality (10): 5 — ambiguity in Equation 2’s covariance; unclear probability/variance estimation.
